titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: New Jersey resident Anne Halsey Ross was a Mt. Holyoke College alumna (1895), an ambulance driver during WWI, a life long donor and volunteer to various charities, and a founding member and president of the American Women's Club in Vienna.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Anne Halsey Ross. Material includes: family correspondence, household bills and receipts, invitations, and clippings. The collection also includes numerous photographs and postcards, several travel view books, and other papers related to Ross's travels abroad.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/ross.htm.
